Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing

package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing

The IndexingTree interface (representing a generic k-d tree) and different kinds of implementation.

k-d trees partition space as a binary tree, so that searching for nearby points based on their locations reduces to refine the region of space in which they lie (= going deeper into the tree) until only one point is found (binary space partitioning). Partitioning can be based on points or on regions. We have only fully implemented region-based trees here.

The IndexingTree interface groups methods that are expected for any indexing tree: finding nearest neighbours, finding items in a small region. Any kind of object can be stored in an IndexingTree (T parameter). Implementations of IndexingTree differ in important details:

  • Descendants of RegionIndexingTree all use double precision coordinates. This implicitly assumes that no two items can be found at the same location.
  • There is a significant improvement in search performance when the region where items lie is known a priori. We designed the BoundedRegionIndexingTree class for this purpose.
  • If the search region is unknown, it can be build on-the-fly from item locations using ExpandingRegionIndexingTree, but there is a performance cost induced by a possibly strongly unbalanced tree in this case.
  • The two LimitedPrecision-prefixed classes (LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree and ExpandingLimitedPrecisionIndexingTree) are duplicates of BoundedRegionIndexingTree and ExpandingRegionIndexingTree using discrete (i.e., longs) instead of continuous (i.e., doubles) coordinates. This implicitly assumes that two items can be found at the same location.

The IndexingNode hierarchy represent the nodes of the various indexing tree implementations. IndexingNode and its subclasses are only internally used by IndexingTree implementations, so their visibility is limited to this package.

We welcome any contribution to improve these implementations and to propose new ones (eg for point-based indexing trees)

Jacques Gignoux - 12 ao√ªt 2021
  • Interface Summary
    Interface
    Description
    IndexingTree<T,​N extends fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.IndexingNode<T,​N>>
    The base interface for an indexing tree.
  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    AbstractIndexingTree<T,​N extends fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.IndexingNode<T,​N>>
    An abstract ancestor for 'generalised QuadTrees'.
    BoundedRegionIndexingTree<T>
    A region-based k-d tree where the size of the initial region is known and used to initialise the tree root node.
    ExpandingLimitedPrecisionIndexingTree<T>
    As a ExpandingRegionIndexingTree, but using discrete coordinates internally instead of continuous ones.
    ExpandingRegionIndexingTree<T>
    A region-based k-d tree where the size of the initial region is unknown.
    LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree<T>
    As a BoundedRegionIndexingTree, but using discrete coordinates internally instead of continuous ones.
    RegionIndexingTree<T>
    Implementation of a region-based k-d tree.
